com.nexmo.client

Class NexmoCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nexmo.client.NexmoCall

  • public class NexmoCall
extends java.lang.Object
    A NexmoCall object is a NexmoConversation for phone calls, created by NexmoClient.call(String, NexmoCallHandler, NexmoRequestListener), or received from NexmoIncomingCallListener.onIncomingCall(NexmoCall). Initiate calls to a user (IP) or phone number (PSTN).

    Example usage:

         //Init the NexmoClient
     //...
     NexmoClient.get().call("username/phone number", NexmoCallHandler.IN_APP/NexmoCallHandler.SERVER, new NexmoRequestListener<NexmoCall>() {
         @Override
         public void onSuccess(NexmoCall call) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
              // Got the NexmoCall object
         }
         @Override
         public void onError(NexmoAPIError error) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }
    });
